name: Sofitel Queenstown Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok well the first thing I have to tell you is that we booked this hotel a superior lake view room about 8 months in advance, when we arrived ( on our wedding anniversary) we had a long wait in reception. being told our room wasnt ready, this was mid way through the afternoon, we was not pleased as we only planned to stay 2 nights before moving on. We were offered free coffee or drinks while we were waiting. This would have been good, however time was passing and there was no sign of the drinks we ordered. We had to continually ask at rerception how long before our room was ready after a age about 1 hour or so we were called to reception and given a key after checking in .
reviews.title: Confusion at the Sofitel

likes.disliked: — The wait at reception when we arrived

reviews.text: When we reached the room we were first of all delighted as we had been upgraded to a suite at no extra cost. The only thing was we didnt have a view as we had booked a lake view. but hey the suite made up for it we did have a small ballcony and the suite its self was of a very high standard infact it was excellent. very tastfully decorated with fantastic furnishings. Bathroom was amazing .
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.... Bad Service....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night we decided to have room service for our evening meal as the suite was so wonderful we decided to eat out one night and eat in the other. Room service was great, food was excellent
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all in all this hotel is a fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great staff, great location.

likes.disliked: — I had to go home eventually!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the hotel is not directlty on the lake it has a few buildings in front of it and the hotel its self isnt so tall, so Im not sure how much of a view we would have had.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Heaven!!!

likes.liked: — The suite we stayed in was amazing!

reviews.text: Nice Hotel by mainstream NZ hotel standards. Nice features in all the rooms, with some nice touches like the underfloor heating, tv in the bathroom, coffee machine etc...
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel on several occasions. Its a great example of NZ design. Great location.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms, but some teething issues?

likes.liked: — Size and comfort of room, spa services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your the type to stare out your window for hours then the St Moritz or new Rooms at the Novotel might be for you. But if your keen to explore Queenstown then the Sofitel is a great place to be.
reviews.title: Fabulous Honeymoon Stay

likes.disliked: — I guess the hotel restaraunts, some issues with the TV, water on bathroom floor

reviews.text: All of the hotels dinner restaurants are great. Try the code bar while your there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: All in all a good choice at a reasonable price in Queenstown.
reviews.title: Doesn't deserve its five star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an amazing hotel and definitely far surpasses any other Sofitel I've stayed in.
reviews.title: Possibly the worlds best Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Stay at the Sofitel in Queenstown

reviews.text: - Very nice bathroom with L'Occitane amenities
reviews.title: One of my best hotel stays ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an upper floor lakeview room at the end of May 2007.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sofitel Queenstown deserves the good reviews it has received on TA. Location is great – right in town, but one block back from the busy streets, so suffers from little noise. Paying extra for a lake view isn’t worth it though. The view is only of a small section of water, and balconies are tiny. Mountain views are arguably better – fewer ugly rooftops.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Asia/Pacific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was very easy, and staff professional. Only criticisms are that the reception and lounge/bar areas are a bit bland and soulless, and porter difficult to find. We were given a voucher for a welcome drink in front of the fire on the first night.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in a great location

description: Experience a new level of sophistication at Sofitel Queenstown Hotel and Spa recently awarded only Qualmark Exclusive Hotel. Inspired by the charms of Paris and the charisma of Queenstown hospitality, be mesmerized by its tasteful combination of French antique chic and local avant-garde design. Centrally located and providing exceptional personal service the hotel truly embodies the Sofitel concept ‘art de vivre’ – the art of living. The lobby and lounge flow into a resplendent reception enclave, invoking the panache of Paris and warm hospitality inherent to any Queenstown stay. Elegantly appointed rooms and suites feature comforts such as Sofitel’s sumptuous 'MyBed', double spa bath and separate walk-in rain shower. Modern surround sound LCD TV/DVD players entertain in bedroom and bathroom, a pillow menu and plush New Zealand possum throws add yet another fine touch. Hotel facilities include signature restaurant, Vie, an intimate Nue Lounge and the luxurious Left Bank Café – part French kitchen, part tea room – open for breakfast and lunch in charming Paris fashion. The ‘piece de resistance’ is LeSpa, a relaxing haven where mind, body and spirit unite. Using French and New Zealand products, LeSpa’s lavish treatments, which include a traditional Maori rituals and Hammam steam room, place strong emphasis on balance, well being and regeneration.
